name: 李鎮宇
objective:
As a 3rd year course in marketing research, this course is designed to

1.　　Introduce the role, scope, process and fundamental concepts of marketing research
2.　　Provide an understanding of research methodology and its implementation (using R)
3.　　Support the student to do a real marketing research project
schedule:
1. Introduction to Marketing Research: Defining Problem and Design 
2. Research Design: Qualitative and Survey Approaches
3. Researching Product Concept
4. Researching Customer Problems
5. Analytical Attributes Research
EMBA Joint Session 1: Harvard Case (week 8)
6. SAS Vaya Quantitative Analysis
7. Sales Forecasting and Analysis
8. Product Protocol
EMBA Joint Session 2: Case Presentation (week 13)
9. Product Use Research
10. Positioning, branding, marketing
11. Market Testing
Presentation (ppt)
scorePolicy:
20% Participation, homework, quizzes
15% Assignment 1: Marketing Case Report (Group)
15% Assignment 2: EMBA project proposal (Group)
20% Presentation 1: EMBA project presentation (Group)
30% PPT Report (Individual)
100% Total
materials:
Core marketing research skills:
Naresh K. Malhotra, Marketing Research: An Applied Orientation, Pearson Education, 2020.

Applying marketing research to the product lifecycle:
C. M. Crawford, C. A Di Benedetto “New Products Management” 12th Edition, McGraw Hill Education, 2021
